user_review: Eric is the guy. Had a great experience here last night. 4 of us. Eric was our waiter. Here are some highlights:-20 shots-salmon truffle roll x2-wasabi scallop roll x2-tuna handrolls-best miso soup ever-other stuffHonestly don't remember everything but great vibe great waiter. Little expensive but wouldGo back for sure.

My boyfriend invited me for my birthday.One of the best sashimi's ive ever ate! There is one unfortunalte i forgot what it is but it just metled in my mouth it was so fresh! Every single one I have tasted is WOW! I suggest you to try it you won't regret it!

Love their chic decor, creative sushi. Amazing taste and fresh of everything I ordered. The waiter was friendly. Great Japanese tea, absolutely one of the best sushi restaurent in Montreal. Recommend!

Stopped into the newly opened Ryu for lunch with my mom this week.  A nice addition to the Greene avenue lunch scene.  It's a little more upscale than a lot of the cafes in the area, when we came in for lunch on a weekday, they asked if we had a reservation.  We didn't, but it wasn't a problem.  We both had the poke bowls, my mom had the vegetarian and I had the salmon.  It was excellent, beautiful presentation and very flavourful, with a generous portion of salmon.  The fish was very fresh.  There were a lot of other interesting things on the menu, mostly sushi, maki and sashimi, with some great lunch specials, that I am looking forward to trying.  This is a proper sit down restaurant, not a place to grab and go a quick lunch, so I would say give yourself at least 30-40 minutes if you plan to eat here.   Service was friendly and knowledgeable.  Prices are on the higher side, expect to spend $20-30 per person for lunch, but the quality is well worth it.

Ryú's location on Ste-Catherine Street in Westmount opened today. I discovered their Peel location earlier this summer thanks to a Yelp review and have been loving it ever since. So I'm super excited for this new location that just opened around the corner from my office. I was walking by today and saw that they had opened, not to waste any time we headed in for lunch. For a restaurant operating on their first day I must say the things seem to be running very smoothly. The only thing I noticed was that they were not yet ready for take out orders, by next week they said they will. The fish was super fresh and very nicely presented, as is always the case at Ryú. This location is quite a bit more roomy than the Peel street location and is decorated in an urban contemporary theme with an Asian influence. All very nice. They also have a large coffee bar set up and seem well equipped. Overall I was really impressed and all signs point towards the food maintaining the excellent quality that I've come to expect from Ryú.
Tuna poke was good. Maki rolls were fishy. Salmon poke had too much mayo. Service was very slow.
